pageTitle: A Guide to the Soap Creek Saloon Archives, 1966-1989
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {16520=Soap Creek Saloon Archives, 1966-1989, Dolph Briscoe Center for American History, The University of Texas at Austin., 2698=Soap Creek Saloon, established in 1973 by George Majewski (b. 1943) and his wife Carlyne Majer (b. 1947), became a major venue for a wide variety of Texas music until it closed permanently in 1985. ATS Management, founded as Austin Tejas Sounds by Carlyne Majer about 1974, booked bands at the music-hall and represented many Austin artists including blues singer Marcia Ball and country fiddler Alvin Crow.}
textBeforeTable: Posters: Soap Creek Calendars, February 1974-June 1983 Kerry Awn (Kerry Fitzgerald) Artists, identified: Posters: 2.325/V41 box 23285151 OCLC Record No. Arranged alphabetically by artists' names. Soap Creek Saloon calendars arranged chronologically under artist's name. Arrangement Four hundred art and music posters collected by George Majewski, owner of Soap Creek Saloon, and his wife Carlyne Majer, owner of ATS Management, a personal management agency for musicians. Posters and monthly calendars document musical performances at the music-hall and other music venues and festivals in Austin, throughout Texas, and in San Francisco, California. Scope and Contents Posters, 1966-1989   Slides
